NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings
public
NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings

NEAT evolution algorithm settings.

Properties
SpeciesCount
public int SpeciesCount { get; set }

The species count.

ElitismProportion
public double ElitismProportion { get; set }

Elitism proportion.  We sort species genomes by fitness and keep the top N%, the other genomes are removed to make way for the offspring.

SelectionProportion
public double SelectionProportion { get; set }

Selection proportion.  We sort species genomes by fitness and select parent genomes for producing offspring from the top N%. Selection is performed prior to elitism being applied, therefore selecting from more genomes than will be made elite is possible.

OffspringAsexualProportion
public double OffspringAsexualProportion { get; set }

The proportion of offspring to be produced from asexual reproduction (mutation).

OffspringSexualProportion
public double OffspringSexualProportion { get; set }

The proportion of offspring to be produced from sexual reproduction.

InterspeciesMatingProportion
public double InterspeciesMatingProportion { get; set }

The proportion of sexual reproductions that will use genomes from different species.

StatisticsMovingAverageHistoryLength
public int StatisticsMovingAverageHistoryLength { get; set }

Length of the history buffer used for calculating the moving average for best fitness, mean fitness and mean complexity.

Functions
NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings
public NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings()

Default constructor.

NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings
public NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings(
NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings copyFrom
)

Copy constructor.

Parameter
copyFrom
NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings

The settings object to copy.

CreateSimplifyingSettings
public NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings CreateSimplifyingSettings()

Creates a new settings object based on the current settings object, but modified to be suitable for use when the evolution algorithm is in simplifying mode.

Returns

A new instance of NeatEvolutionAlgorithmSettings.

Validate
public void Validate()

Validate the settings, and throw an exception if not valid.

As a 'simple' collection of properties there is no construction time check that can be performed, therefore this method is supplied to allow consumers of a settings object to validate it before using it.
